channel.title: Best IRC web applet?
channel.description:
I'm looking for a IRC web client to add to my website but all the ones I have tried have had their flaws.
I used a JAVA one and it didn't work for a lot of people and then tried an AJAX one which again is indicating problems for certain users.
What's the most reliable one to use?

item.title: Best IRC web applet?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:18, topic:434867”]Probably because the server address has changed. It’s moved from .com to .xxx

I guess a mod should fix that(Looks like a great topic imo)[/quote].com still works…

Read full topic

item.title: Best IRC web applet?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:10, topic:434867”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=537584.msg3931236#msg3931236 date=1330699737]
Implying that he was looking for a non-java non-ajax solution…

Plus I can say PJIRC has a lot of issues with some windows 7 users.
[/quote]

him saying…

I used a JAVA one and it didn’t work for a lot of people and then tried an AJAX one which again is indicating problems for certain users.

is not an implication but more so of what he has already tried. He mentioned they all had flaws and is asking for suggestions. He never said he refused to try another java based one etc. <3 iwubudavidbutyouneedtoreadbetweenthelines.[/quote]If he was implying he was willing to try another java based client he would have just named the java client he already tried so nobody would suggest that one…

l2read the actual lines
or kryptix needs to be more clear

Read full topic

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:434867”]Implying that he was looking for a non-java non-ajax solution…

Plus I can say PJIRC has a lot of issues with some windows 7 users.[/quote]

him saying…

I used a JAVA one and it didn't work for a lot of people and then tried an AJAX one which again is indicating problems for certain users.

is not an implication but more so of what he has already tried. He mentioned they all had flaws and is asking for suggestions. He never said he refused to try another java based one etc. <3 iwubudavidbutyouneedtoreadbetweenthelines.

@op

JWIRC isn’t bad either
